item.title: Kyedae and TenZ Announce Amicable Split After Six Years
item.content:encoded:
Kyedae and TenZ, the esports and content sweethearts who got engaged almost four years ago, have announced an amicable split on social media. The pair, who made their name competing in and streaming VALORANT, became an iconic duo and one of the most recognisable romantic powerhouses in the modern gaming space.

In a lengthy post on social media, Kyedae revealed that they’ve been separated for ‘quite some time’ and that the break-up hasn’t come from a place of resentment or failure.

Why Did Kyedae and TenZ Split Up?

The full post from Kyedae on social media outlines the situation:

Hey everybody,

Tyson (TenZ) and I feel ready to share some personal news.

We’ve actually been broken up for quite some time now. Toward the end of our relationship, we came to a realization that wasn’t easy to accept: we had stopped growing as individuals.

For most of our relationship, we did everything together.
Work — together.
Hobbies and interests — together.
Pretty much everything — together.

We’ve even joked in the past that although we were together for six years, it felt like at least thirty.

We moved in together just weeks after meeting, and from ages 17 to 24, that was all we knew. Over time, it became clear that we needed space to grow into our own people.

We know the internet often looks for “the tea” but the truth is sirnple — we grew apart.
There was no wrongdoing, no resentment, and no single event that caused this.

We still care deeply about each other and genuinely want the best for one another,
We’re also incredibly grateful for the time and life we shared together!

Thank you for respecting our privacy.

Rumors concerning the split had been circulating in streaming and social circles for some time, and this post effectively puts a nail in the coffin for them.

The pair were quick to get ahead of comments claiming that their engagement post from August 2022 ‘did not age well’, poking fun at themselves in a self-deprecating manner to beat the trolls.

It has admittedly been a rocky few years for the duo. TenZ announced his retirement from competing last year, and in 2023, Kyedae revealed a cancer diagnosis that eventually took her out of the streaming space indefinitely.

item.title: Steam’s Newest Feature is Huge for Early Access Games
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever invested time, money, and effort into an early access game on Steam and wondered exactly when it’ll leave early access and graduate to a full release? You’re not alone, and Valve has recognized that. In a recent update, the team behind Steam revealed that a new feature will give early access games greater transparency into their schedules.

When developers list early access products on Steam, they now have a visible field to indicate when the game will leave early access, whether that’s the year or the exact day.

Early Access Games Are Some of the Best

In the last few years, we’ve seen countless early access titles surface on Steam and flourish, using the time granted by an earlier push to generate funds for the full development of a new title. In some cases, early access games flounder and fall, especially if they take a long time to leave that state.

But sometimes, an early access gem will appear, stick to a roadmap, and hit a full launch deadline without any issues.

The most recent example that rings true to that is Endnight’s Sons of the Forest, which was released in early access and then launched as a full game exactly one year later, storming to success on Steam.

In a new blog post, Valve revealed that the early access date field is being added to promote better transparency for early adopters.

The team explained:

Occasionally, developers with a game in Early Access would ask us proactively if there was any official place to display a planned 1.0 date. They wanted existing and potential players to know about their plans. Many studios were already sharing their 1.0 dates in other places– within the text description on the store page, via Steam Event news posts, on social media, in their forums, and so on.

However, they advised against using it just to use it, stressing that developers should only add a date if they’re relatively confident they’ll hit it. Otherwise, they risk running into trouble with their prospective fans.

item.title: Fallout 76 Crossplay is Closer Than Ever and Fans Remain Hopeful
item.content:encoded:
Anyone who is anyone in the Fallout 76 space knows about the game’s glaring lack of crossplay mechanics. It has been one of the biggest sticking points for players over the years, exacerbated by the fact that so many similar games have crossplay features.

Bethesda Game Studios is well aware of the yearning players have to blow open the Fallout 76 ecosystem. Last year, we sat down with the team in Los Angeles and learned how difficult it would be to add crossplay to Fallout 76, and in a new interview, that was reiterated.

But the way it was framed suggests it’s now a plan… Almost.

Will Fallout 76 Ever Get Crossplay?

In June 2025, we sat down with Bethesda’s Jon Rush and Bill LaCoste to talk about Gone Fission, the most recent Fallout 76 update at the time. One of the key questions we asked concerned crossplay and cross-progression mechanics, to which Bill said:

People ask us that all the time. And the thing for us, it has been more of a technical challenge for us to be able to do that. It’s not that we don’t think about it, we think about it often.

But, overall, no real plans right now to introduce crossplay, but certainly, we get asked to consider it very often, so we do.

Maybe in the future.

In October, another interview surfaced between Bethesda Game Studios and the Iron Lords, and again, it was stressed that they’re asked about Fallout 76 crossplay all the time, but there were ‘no real plans’ to introduce the feature, much to the chagrin of players:

It’s never a no, right?

But what I will say, is that those are decisions usually made at the very beginning of development, and right now it’s a huge technical lift for us to have crossplay or cross-progression on it (Fallout 76).

It’s something we get asked about constantly from players. I understand why, I feel the same way. I’d love to go play on Steam and then go play on Xbox or PlayStation and just have my character, but right now, it’s a little bit too difficult for us to pull off.

But then the pair appeared in yet another interview, this time with Polygon, and it seems things have changed. Rush and LaCoste altered their direction on the Fallout 76 crossplay topic, going from ‘too difficult’ and ‘no real plans’ to something much more tangible.

Jon Rush said:

We are looking into it, and we have plans to try to scope out what that work is going to entail for us.

It’s just not in the immediate plans for us. We know players want it.

And he was backed up by LaCoste:

What we can promise players is that we will continue to investigate, we will continue to try to establish plans to make that a thing in the future, just not in the short term.

It’s a little weak, but Jon’s comment about ‘we have plans’ and ‘we are looking into it’ is perhaps the closest we’ve ever gotten to the Fallout 76 crossplay debate being resolved. If they’re sizing up the technical delivery of crossplay mechanics, we’re one step nearer to playing with our friends across those gaming borders.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Designer Hypes New Ragdoll Physics System
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26’s gameplay designer, Cornell Gunter, is very excited about the ragdoll physics in the upcoming video game. He says the new gameplay tweaks will allow wrestling moves to connect properly with weapons instead of being hampered by invisible barriers.

WWE 2K26 is set to release worldwide on March 13. This year’s game features the return of several match types to WWE video games, including Inferno Matches and 3 Stages of Hell, and several new gameplay improvements.

No More Invisible Walls When Slamming Wrestlers Onto Weapons in WWE 2K26

During a recent interview with JustBryan, WWE 2K26 gameplay designer Cornell Gunter said his favorite improved gameplay mechanic is the addition of ragdoll physics to the game.

Gunter praised the removal of “invisible walls” and how it allows players to use weapons in more creative ways, enhancing the realism that sometimes occurs in wild, anything-goes matches on WWE television.

“Being able to remove that invisible wall when you’re performing moves and performing certain things like that, which is very important to us,” he said. “Being able to watch the collision and the figures of how the superstars react when they’re hitting weapons and all those kinds of things… Those are the things I’m really excited about for gameplay.”

More Features in WWE 2K26

WWE 2K26 also features several improvements that give players more control over the realism in matches, starting well before the bell rings. Players can customize how much pyro goes off, which camera angles are used, and more during wrestler entrances this year.

Also, there’s a new AI customization that lets players create sequences of moves the AI will always try to hit in succession, adding realism to every match. Learn more about these features, new commentary from legendary WWE Superstars over the past, and more at this link.

item.title: Embark Responds to ARC Raiders Players Unsatisfied With Roadmap
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios CEO Patrick Söderlund responds to players who aren’t fully satisfied with the current ARC Raiders roadmap.

In a sea of live service games that can turn into a watery grave far too soon, ARC Raiders has managed to catch on and become a hit with players worldwide. It even won Best Multiplayer Game at the Game Awards in 2025.

Embark recently released a roadmap for the game detailing upcoming additions, including new maps and more. However, not all players are fully satisfied with the game’s current direction, as they feel the roadmap doesn’t provide enough incentive to keep playing.

Embark CEO Acknowledges Player Frustration With ARC Raiders Roadmap

In an interview with IGN, Patrick Söderlund was asked what he would say to players who weren’t satisfied with the recent plan. Notably, he wants dissatisfied players to understand that they are heard, and he even claims he would feel the same if he were in their shoes, but only because they do not yet have full details.

“If we get into the studio development schedule and make that public, we’re probably going to be in a world of hurt,” he said.

Furthermore, Söderlund stated that they are developing things as they go. However, he says players will see that the patch notes are very detailed and that the organization wants to be seen as transparent. He knows that some won’t forgive if they cannot deliver on certain wants, but his main goal is to provide continuous updates to the game, saying he feels it’s worth its $40 price tag.

“From the beginning of January, whenever everyone was back, we’re working around the clock to deliver as much content as we can to players,” he said.

Players can check out the full roadmap here. Insider Gaming will continue to provide future updates on when new content will come to ARC Raiders.

item.title: Cold Snap is Coming Back to ARC Raiders as a Regular Map Condition
item.content:encoded:
Cold Snap, the festive-themed update that introduced Candleberries, a new event, and some harsh, inclement weather, is coming back to ARC Raiders as a map condition in the regular rotation. This will join the pool made up of the likes of Harvester, Hidden Bunker, and Electromagnetic Storm, even if it doesn’t make much sense.

In December, Cold Snap came around because it was a winter-themed event bursting with festive potential. It existing beyond that feels a little strange, and it’s being passed off by Embark Studios as ‘sporadic snowfall’.

Doesn’t Make Sense, But Okay

Cold Snap was a limited-time map condition that existed to serve a purpose, and that was the facilitation of the new festive LTM and new player project. Now that the festive window is over, the condition has understandably moved on, arguably to make way for more map conditions, coming as soon as later this month.

But wait!

Embark Studios has taken Cold Snap and injected it back into the map rotation for ‘the foreseeable future’. From February 10, Cold Snap will be a playable condition once again, with blizzards freezing maps, blanketing them in thick snow, and making it a hazardous concept to even creep outside.

Fans were quick to point out that this is the epitome of reusing and recycling content, and it comes mere weeks after the map condition was removed from the pool, which was always going to be the plan.

The ARC Raiders roadmap suggests we’re getting a new map condition soon, and based on earlier scouting, it should be Toxic Swamp, but it could still be up to three weeks away.

Are you happy that Embark Studios has brought Cold Snap back to ARC Raiders, or would you rather have had something totally new? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Eric Barone Hesitant to Make Stardew Valley 2 Due to Fan Expectations
item.content:encoded:
Eric Barone discusses the possibility of a Stardew Valley 2

Stardew Valley was released a decade ago and became a massive hit. The game has inspired many farming sims and cozy games since its release. However, 10 years later, the game’s creator is discussing the possibility of a sequel, including when plans to make one were underway and more.

Stardew Valley 2 Was in the Works Before Eric Barone Pivoted to An Upcoming Release

In an interview with IGN, Eric Barone, aka ConcernedApe, noted that he would be interested in the idea of working on a sequel to Stardew. Personally, he would be more interested in creating a new world with new characters. However, he’s worried that players are too attached to Pelican town and the villagers who call it home.

Furthermore, he revealed that he had begun working on a Stardew Valley 2 but ultimately chose to pivot to the Haunted Chocolatier, an upcoming release he says could be seen as a follow-up to the popular 2016 farming sim.

“There was a time where I was starting to work on a Stardew Valley 2, but, I don’t know. For various reasons, I moved over to Haunted Chocolatier instead. Haunted Chocolatier, you could say, is like Stardew Valley 2, but it’s a bit different of a game,” he said.

Still, Fans Shouldn’t Expect Stardew Valley 2 from His Next Game

Despite saying players can view the upcoming game as “Stardew Valley 2,” it is clearly meant as a spiritual successor. In fact, Barone is concerned that expectations for the upcoming game may be too high. He admits it’s a challenge to decide when the next game will be ready for release because there’s so much to live up to, given the legacy of his previous game.

“I want to just make the game I want to make, but I also don’t want a bunch of people to not like the game because they were expecting a certain thing,” he said.

As of now, there’s no release date planned for Choclatier. Barone acknowledged that any Stardew Valley-related matter would require his full attention. However, he hopes that, at least over the next decade, Haunted Choclatier will be released. He even mentioned that there could be another Stardew Valley project by then.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1695: Hints and Answer for February 8, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1695 for February 8, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 8, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1695 is one of the tougher puzzles you’ll face. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 5.8 of 6 guesses. That makes it a guess and a half harder than the 4.3-guess average from February 7.

General Wordle Hints For February 8

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word often describes something becoming part of something else, not standing alone.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly used in technical or instructional contexts.
  • Hint 3: The action implied is usually deliberate, not accidental.
  • Hint 4: Once this happens, removing it isn’t always easy.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1695 for February 8, 2026.

Starter Words For February 8, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • ELITE
  • DEBTS
  • BIDET
  • DIMES

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1695 On February 8, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: EMBED

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

EMBED is a verb that means “to fix into a surrounding mass.” It can also mean “to incorporate or contain as an essential part or characteristic.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1694 on February 7, 2026

Answer: BLEAT

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1695?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 9 will be Wordle Game #1696.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.
